bio: Photographer National Geographic Magazine and Human Rights Watch. Focus on humanitarian issues and the impact of conflict on communities.

posts.caption:
Over the next month I will be posting images from a retrospective exhibition I have in collaboration with the International Criminal Court. The work spans nearly 20 years and covers conflicts where the court has an ongoing interest. @natgeo @hrw @internationalcriminalcourt #morejustworld⠀#photooftheday ⠀
www.icc-cpi.int⠀
https://www.icc-cpi.int/romestatute20⠀
Family ⠀
⠀
The mother of Eliam Fedongare 24, greets him and celebrates as he arrives home wirth his father Jean de Dieux. They were abducted in their farm by Seleka as they fled Bangui to carry their belongings for them. They were forced marched through the bush for 9 days and 4 of the others who were taken were shot and killed when they became too tired to continue. They escaped during an attack on a local village.⠀

For those in Norway, go see Føniks an incredible film opening next week in Oslo. Synopsis here: From a young age, Jill has acted as the responsible adult in her small family. She cares for her loving but mentally unstable mother and her younger brother. The news that their estranged father will be visiting on Jill’s birthday gives the children much needed hope.
When the family is struck by tragedy, Jill keeps it a secret.
At first it seems that her fathers’ arrival will solve everything. The whirlwind of
excitement this arrival creates is the perfect antidote to what Jill has just gone through/experienced. Her dream of a glamorous life together with their father, now becomes a matter of survival for herself and her young brother.

Over the next month I will be posting images from a retrospective exhibition I have in collaboration with the International Criminal Court. The work spans nearly 20 years and covers conflicts where the court has an ongoing interest. @natgeo @hrw #morejustworld⠀

A sudden end to peace ⠀
⠀
Russian troops pull out of Gori after a war which lasted one week. (2008)⠀

Today I want to highlight the conflict gold trade from eastern Congo. A new investigation by The Sentry reveals that 283 US companies may be buying gold that funds deadly conflict in Congo. Ask the US, UN, and European Union to hold corrupt gold traders accountable for their actions. Link in Profile. #CongoGold
https://thesentry.org/reports/the-golden-laundromat/

⠀

Solace ⠀
⠀
People displaced by the fighting between ex-Seleka and anti-balaka forces find shelter in an old factory on the grounds of the Catholic church in Bossangoa. ⠀

⠀
Safety in Numbers⠀
⠀
Children gather in Gulu, Northern Uganda. They fled the villages in the late afternoon to avoid abduction and death at the hands of Joseph Kony's Lord's Resistance Army (LRA) up to 25,000 children sleep outside in Gulu town each evening. Nearly 9,000 children have been abducted in the past twelve months. After sleeping the night outside in the wet, cold open-air bus station they rise at 4am to start the 10-20km walk back to their villages. (2003)⠀
⠀
⠀

Over the next month I will be posting images from a retrospective exhibition I have in collaboration with the International Criminal Court. The work spans nearly 20 years and covers conflicts where the court has an ongoing interest. @natgeo @hrw #morejustworld⠀

https://www.icc-cpi.int/romestatute20⠀
⠀
⠀
Childhood erased⠀
⠀
A child soldier with the Mayi-Mayi militia waits in Kanyabyonga as CNDP rebels advance. He was recruited while young men in the area were being abducted by the rebel forces. He didn’t want to be forced to fight, so he volunteered with the Mayi-Mayi.⠀
⠀
⠀

Opening in Oslo this week. Go see! Set in Oslo today, Føniks tells the story of Jill, who from a young age, has acted as the adult in her family. She cares for her mentally unstable mother Astrid, as well as for her younger brother, Bo. Astrid’s volatile behavior has
caused the two children to constantly walk a tightrope in order to avoid anything that can trigger their mother’s outbreaks.
Things seem to look up when Astrid lands a job interview and Jill works hard to support her mother and boost her self-esteem. The news that their
estranged father, Nils, will be visiting on Jill’s 14th birthday, gives the children with much needed hope. But the small family is stricken by a tragedy. In shock, Jill decides to bury the truth.
At first it seems that Nils’ arrival will solve everything. The whirlwind of excitement Nils creates is the perfect antidote to what Jill has just gone through/experienced. Her dream of a glamorous life together with their father,
now becomes a matter of survival for herself and her young brother.

Displaced⠀
⠀
People in Kiwanja village wait for food handouts from the World Food Programme. Forced displacement is a crime. (2006)⠀

Please join me in watching
the world premiere of #journeyofgold, and take action to support responsible gold sourcing from Congo

www.journeyofgold.org
#knowyourgold #CongoGold #photooftheday @enoughproject

This week, I’m going to be sharing some exciting new ways you can join me in taking action to support peace in the Democratic Republic of Congo by raising awareness about the conflict gold trade and ensuring the products we buy contain #conflictfree #congogold. Stay tuned. @enoughproject #photooftheday @natgeo

Mutilated ⠀
⠀
Maria, a mother of three, lost her arm defending her children in Nizi, northeastern Congo. She recounts the story of soldiers eating her flesh after they had hacked off her arm.⠀

Remembering⠀
⠀
Luba Tkhlasdze 65 breaks down after being looted by Ossetian militia. They destroyed the only photographs she had of her dead son and they killed her brother in law.⠀

Trauma⠀
⠀
A Gori resident mourns the deaths of her neighbours in a bomb attack on her home.
It’s here! #oneplasticfreeday #saynotoplastic challenge yourself. Say no to plastic today to see how prolific this material is in our lives.

Taken away⠀
⠀
The wife of Nana Abdul Karim 34, father of 8 children, screams and faints after learning of the death of her husband in PK12. He was shot whilst buying breakfast for his children by French soldiers. They reported he was demonstrating and firing a weapon at them, but most people in this district have only bows and arrows.

Rescue and escape⠀
⠀
Valantine Mbolibirani 15 years old (she was 13 when she was abducted) was abducted in jly 2009 for 7 months. She was taken directly to Kony and forced to be one of his many wives. She was accused of being a sorcerer and was going to be tried by Kony. She escaped the day before the trial after saving the life on one woman by hiding her from the LRA. She lay naked in a field for 2 days and nights hiding from her attackers as they searched for her. When they left she came out of the bush and found a 2 year old boy crying for his mother who had been abducted. She picked him up and walked naked to the nearest village in search of help.⠀

Over the next month I will be posting images from a retrospective exhibition I have in collaboration with the International Criminal Court. The work spans nearly 20 years and covers conflicts where the court has an ongoing interest. @natgeo @hrw #morejustworld⠀

https://www.icc-cpi.int/romestatute20⠀
Healing⠀
⠀
Masua Abaneru 22 fisherman and father of 3 children was abducted by the LRA and used as a porter. When he became too tired to continue he was taken into the bush and the LRA commanders forced the children to hit him with sticks until he was dead. He woke up several days later and crawled to find help. He was found by some people coming tothe village to bury the dead after they heard of the attack. He has not been able to work for over one year due to the attack.

A new life⠀
⠀
A father of newborn takes shelter under trees while waiting for the departure of the convoy towards Chad. Muslims flee the town of Bangui together with Chadian special forces. Over 10,000 peole leave the city for Chad on a huge convoy as the Muslim population is forced out of the country by the population of CAR.⠀

Here is a walk through of the exhibit displayed at the city hall in the Hauge, Netherlands in collaboration with the international criminal court on the closing day of the trail of Bosco Ntaganda, the images of the people impacted by his crimes were visible. #photooftheday @internationalcriminalcourt @humanrightswatch @natgeo

⠀

Trying to Survive ⠀
⠀
The Christian population around PK13 on the outskirts of Bangui loot and burn the homes of the Muslims who have fled after the Seleka President Michel Djotodia resigned and left the country in disarray The country was ruled by a minority Muslim government after the coup in March 2013. After months of oppression by the Muslim Seleka Government the local population take out their anger and frustrations on the largely innocent Muslim population.⠀
⠀
Visions of midsummer #Norway #oslo #midsummer #fire

Survival⠀
⠀
Khadidja Alhadji Adbou, a 30-year-old Mboro woman, witnessed anti-balaka forces shooting and killing her husband and three children. In the same attack, she was shot in the neck but survived.⠀
⠀
